| The Arch Priest:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is male.
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* lets you close unless attacked.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                          |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [monst.c#line3120](/wiki/Monst.c#line3120 "Monst.c")                                                     |

The **Arch Priest**, @, is the [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest") [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"). He is identical to a [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") in attacks, resistances and attributes, with the only difference being slightly lower [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed").

The Arch Priest has a strong weapon attack, a [kick](/wiki/Kick "Kick") attack, and will attempt to cast two clerical [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") during each of his turns. He possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") like high priests do.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), killing quest leaders no longer makes the game [unwinnable](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable"), and the Arch Priest and other quest leaders are given stat buffs and additional equipment to compensate. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") becomes 90.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

The Arch Priests resides within the Great Temple, the [Priest quest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest")'s home level, and stands on the adjacent square to the east of the [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned") [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar"). He is [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") similar equipment to other aligned priests: a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace") of an [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") from +1 to +3, which has a 1⁄2 chance to be made cursed.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield"), 20–29 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"), and one of the following cloaks: a 6⁄7 chance of a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe"), a 2⁄21 chance of a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection"), and a 1⁄21 chance of a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of [commit 20cbadcf](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e), the Arch Priest [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a +4 robe and a +4 [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace").

## Strategy

The Arch Priest is perhaps the strongest quest leader in *NetHack* in terms of [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") and sheer damage output, though this will not normally be witnessed in action unless you use [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict") else or manage to commit [a game-ending error](/wiki/Unwinnable "Unwinnable").

## History

The Arch Priest is introduced with most other quest leaders in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

Some variants make the Arch Priest and other quest leaders stronger to accommodate changes to the Quest and its entry mechanics, and these changes may be incorporated into upcoming versions of *NetHack* or else be borrowed from them.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), the Arch Priest has his difficulty increased to 24. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") is 90. He also gains [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), all three points of the Arch Priest's base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") are in the protection category.

The Arch Priest always generates with a blessed +7 [khakkhara](/wiki/Khakkhara "Khakkhara"), a blessed +7 [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe"), and a blessed +7 [helm of brilliance](/wiki/Helm_of_brilliance "Helm of brilliance").

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase, flight and resistances.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in xNetHack.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the Arch Priest's stats and resistances are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase and flight.

The Arch Priest [always generates with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a +4 [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") and a +4 [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"). If [The Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/The_Mitre_of_Holiness "The Mitre of Holiness") is successfully [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for by a non-Priest, there is a x⁄x+1 chance (where *x* is the amount of previous [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") wishes) of a hostile Arch Priest generating adjacent to the character with the artifact in his possession.

All of the above information also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

\[...] For the two priests were talking exactly like priests, piously, with learning and leisure, about the most aerial enigmas of theology. The little Essex priest spoke the more simply, with his round face turned to the strengthening stars; the other talked with his head bowed, as if he were not even worthy to look at them. But no more innocently clerical conversation could have been heard in any white Italian cloister or black Spanish cathedral. The first he heard was the tail of one of Father Brown's sentences, which ended: "... what they really meant in the Middle Ages by the heavens being incorruptible." The taller priest nodded his bowed head and said: "Ah, yes, these modern infidels appeal to their reason; but who can look at those millions of worlds and not feel that there may well be wonderful universes above us where reason is utterly unreasonable?"

\[ The Innocence of Father Brown, by G.K. Chesterton ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 261](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L261)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 689](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L689)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Arch Priest

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ Arch Priest
Difficulty 30
Attacks Weapon 4d10, kick 2d8, 2d8 casting clerical, 2d8 casting clerical
@ Arch Priest
Difficulty 30
Attacks

Weapon 4d10, kick 2d8, 2d8 casting clerical, 2d8 casting clerical

Base level 25
Base experience 876
Speed 12
Base AC 7
Base MR 70
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances Fire, shock, sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed None

The Arch Priest:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • lets you close unless attacked.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3120

The Arch Priest, @, is the Priest quest leader. He is identical to a high priest in attacks, resistances and attributes, with the only difference being slightly lower speed.

The Arch Priest has a strong weapon attack, a kick attack, and will attempt to cast two clerical monster spells during each of his turns. He possesses fire resistance, shock resistance, sleep resistance, and poison resistance like high priests do.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 20cbadcf, killing quest leaders no longer makes the game unwinnable, and the Arch Priest and other quest leaders are given stat buffs and additional equipment to compensate. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his MR score becomes 90.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SporkHack
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 xNetHack
    • 4.4 SpliceHack
    • 4.5 EvilHack
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

The Arch Priests resides within the Great Temple, the Priest quest's home level, and stands on the adjacent square to the east of the unaligned altar. He is always generated with similar equipment to other aligned priests: a mace of an enchantment from +1 to +3, which has a 1⁄2 chance to be made cursed.[1] small shield, 20–29 zorkmids, and one of the following cloaks: a 6⁄7 chance of a robe, a 2⁄21 chance of a cloak of protection, and a 1⁄21 chance of a cloak of magic resistance.[2]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As part of commit 20cbadcf, the Arch Priest always generates with a +4 robe and a +4 mace.

Strategy

The Arch Priest is perhaps the strongest quest leader in NetHack in terms of difficulty and sheer damage output, though this will not normally be witnessed in action unless you use conflict else or manage to commit a game-ending error.

History

The Arch Priest is introduced with most other quest leaders in NetHack 3.1.0.

Variants

Some variants make the Arch Priest and other quest leaders stronger to accommodate changes to the Quest and its entry mechanics, and these changes may be incorporated into upcoming versions of NetHack or else be borrowed from them.

SporkHack

In SporkHack, the Arch Priest has his difficulty increased to 24. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his MR score is 90. He also gains flight and stoning resistance.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, all three points of the Arch Priest's base AC are in the protection category.

The Arch Priest always generates with a blessed +7 khakkhara, a blessed +7 robe, and a blessed +7 helm of brilliance.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase, flight and resistances.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in xNetHack.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the Arch Priest's stats and resistances are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase and flight.

The Arch Priest always generates with a +4 robe and a +4 mace. If The Mitre of Holiness is successfully wished for by a non-Priest, there is a x⁄x+1 chance (where x is the amount of previous artifact wishes) of a hostile Arch Priest generating adjacent to the character with the artifact in his possession.

All of the above information also applies to Hack'EM.

Encyclopedia entry

[...] For the two priests were talking exactly like priests, piously, with learning and leisure, about the most aerial enigmas of theology. The little Essex priest spoke the more simply, with his round face turned to the strengthening stars; the other talked with his head bowed, as if he were not even worthy to look at them. But no more innocently clerical conversation could have been heard in any white Italian cloister or black Spanish cathedral. The first he heard was the tail of one of Father Brown's sentences, which ended: "... what they really meant in the Middle Ages by the heavens being incorruptible." The taller priest nodded his bowed head and said: "Ah, yes, these modern infidels appeal to their reason; but who can look at those millions of worlds and not feel that there may well be wonderful universes above us where reason is utterly unreasonable?"

[ The Innocence of Father Brown, by G.K. Chesterton ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 261
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 689

The {{questmon|Arch Priest|Priest|leader}} He is identical to a [[high priest]] in attacks, resistances and attributes, with the only difference being slightly lower [[speed]].

The Arch Priest has a strong weapon attack, a [[kick]] attack, and will attempt to cast two clerical [[monster spell]]s during each of his turns. He possesses [[fire resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], and [[poison resistance]] like high priests do.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e}}, killing quest leaders no longer makes the game [[unwinnable]], and the Arch Priest and other quest leaders are given stat buffs and additional equipment to compensate. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] becomes 90.}}

==Generation==
The Arch Priests resides within the Great Temple, the [[Priest quest]]'s home level, and stands on the adjacent square to the east of the [[unaligned]] [[altar]]. He is [[Monster starting inventory|always generated with]] similar equipment to other aligned priests: a [[mace]] of an [[enchantment]] from +1 to +3, which has a {{frac|2}} chance to be made cursed.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|261|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[small shield]], 20–29 [[zorkmid]]s, and one of the following cloaks: a {{frac|6|7}} chance of a [[robe]], a {{frac|2|21}} chance of a [[cloak of protection]], and a {{frac|21}} chance of a [[cloak of magic resistance]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|689|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As part of {{commit|20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e}}, the Arch Priest [[Monster starting inventory|always generates with]] a +4 robe and a +4 [[mace]].}}

==Strategy==
The Arch Priest is perhaps the strongest quest leader in ''NetHack'' in terms of [[Monster difficulty|difficulty]] and sheer damage output, though this will not normally be witnessed in action unless you use [[conflict]] else or manage to commit [[Unwinnable|a game-ending error]].

==History==
The Arch Priest is introduced with most other quest leaders in [[NetHack 3.1.0]].

==Variants==
Some variants make the Arch Priest and other quest leaders stronger to accommodate changes to the Quest and its entry mechanics, and these changes may be incorporated into upcoming versions of ''NetHack'' or else be borrowed from them.

===SporkHack===
In [[SporkHack]], the Arch Priest has his difficulty increased to 24. The Arch Priest's speed is increased to 15, and his [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] is 90. He also gains [[flight]] and [[stoning resistance]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], all three points of the Arch Priest's base [[AC]] are in the protection category.

The Arch Priest always generates with a blessed +7 [[khakkhara]], a blessed +7 [[robe]], and a blessed +7 [[helm of brilliance]].

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase, flight and resistances.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], the Arch Priest's stats are improved as in xNetHack.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the Arch Priest's stats and resistances are improved as in SporkHack, minus the difficulty increase and flight.

The Arch Priest [[Monster starting inventory|always generates with]] a +4 [[robe]] and a +4 [[mace]]. If [[The Mitre of Holiness]] is successfully [[wish]]ed for by a non-Priest, there is a {{frac|x|x+1}} chance (where ''x'' is the amount of previous [[artifact]] wishes) of a hostile Arch Priest generating adjacent to the character with the artifact in his possession.

All of the above information also applies to [[Hack'EM]].

But no more innocently clerical conversation could have been heard in any white Italian cloister or black Spanish cathedral.
